definitions.definition: A product of fertilization in a plant, specifically:

subdefinitions.definition: The seed -bearing part of a plant; often edible , colourful, fragrant, and sweet or sour; produced from a floral ovary after fertilization.
The spores of cryptogams and their accessory organs.

definitions.definition: Any sweet or sour, edible part of a plant that resembles seed-bearing fruit ( see former sense ) even if it does not develop from a floral ovary.

subdefinitions.definition: A sweet or sweetish vegetable , such as the petioles of rhubarb , that resembles a true fruit or is used in cookery as if it was a fruit.

definitions.definition: An end result , effect , or consequence ; advantageous or disadvantageous result .
examples: His long nights in the office eventually bore fruit when his business boomed and he was given a raise.
He spent his retirement enjoying the fruits of his labour.

definitions.definition: Of, belonging to, related to, or having fruit or its characteristics; ( of living things ) producing or consuming fruit.
A homosexual man ; ( derogatory , figurative ) an effeminate man .

examples: The litter was the fruit of the union between our whippet and their terrier.

main_definition: ( botany ) A product of fertilization in a plant, specifically:
secondary_definitions: Any sweet or sour, edible part of a plant that resembles seed-bearing fruit ( see former sense ) even if it does not develop from a floral ovary.
An end result , effect , or consequence ; advantageous or disadvantageous result .
( attributive ) Of, belonging to, related to, or having fruit or its characteristics; ( of living things ) producing or consuming fruit.
( dated , colloquial , derogatory ) A homosexual man ; ( derogatory , figurative ) an effeminate man . [from 1900]
( archaic ) Offspring from a sexual union.
